newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain's Treasury account with BoS rose in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Spain's Treasury account with BoS rose in 1996.

text.p: The Treasury substantially increased its current account balance with the Bank of Spain in 1996, Budget Secretary Jose Folgado said on Wednesday.
This was a defensive measure to offset any possible change in market expectations ahead of Europe's planned single currency, he said.
"We thought it was a good policy to have a big cushion for this account to counterbalance any possibile market volatility in a year so crucial as 1997," Folgado told a parliamentary committee.
The Spanish Treasury's current account balance rose by 967.6 billion pesetas during 1996 to 2,529 billion pesetas in December 1996 from 1,561 billion pesetas at end of 1995.
That increase was due to favourable market conditions and to the downtrend in interest rates, Folgado explained.
